com.absynth.battleship.data

Class Coord

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.absynth.battleship.data.Coord

  • public final class Coord
extends java.lang.Object
    Convenient data class used to store Battleship coordinates in the form of (integer, character). These coordinates must within the range of COL_CHARACTERS and 1-ROW_MAX for the column and row respectively.

    If the object is initialized with invalid coordinate, then the row and the column are set to INVALID_ROW and INVALID_COL respectively.

    Note: the implementation of this class should always make sure the Coord is valid using the static method provided with this class isValidCoord(Coord).
    Author:
    David Boivin (Absynth)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Coord(int row, char col)
      Default constructor which accepts any integer as a row and any character as column but will set the row to INVALID_ROW if it is not within the range 1 - ROW_MAX and set the column to INVALID_COL if the column is not within the characters array COL_CHARACTERS.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Coord

        public Coord(int row,
             char col)
        Default constructor which accepts any integer as a row and any character as column but will set the row to INVALID_ROW if it is not within the range 1 - ROW_MAX and set the column to INVALID_COL if the column is not within the characters array COL_CHARACTERS.

        Note: will capitalize any character given as the column.
        Parameters:
        row - An integer representing row.
        col - A character representing a column.

    • Method Detail

        Method for retrieving the column.
        Returns:

      • isValidCol

        private boolean isValidCol(char col)
        Retruns whether the given string is valid or not, meaning whether the given character is equal to one of characters in COL_CHARACTERS. Note: this method brute forces through the look to check the equality.
        Parameters:
        col - The column to check.
        Returns:
        true if the character is valid. false if the character is not within the allowed list of characters

      • isValidCoord

        public static boolean isValidCoord(Coord c)
        Convenience method which determines if the coordinate is valid or not, meaning whether the row or the column is INVALID_ROW or INVALID_COL respectively.
        Parameters:
        c - The coordinate to test.
        Returns:
        true if the coordinate is valid and false if it is invalide.
